reviewText:
We finally get to play as Leonidas and get a Thermoplae map :D

But lets get serious
This game isnt about who as the bigger army or the better units, or who is better at strategy games (I lied about the last one but it isnt relying on whos good at strategy and who is not than previous total war games), butit is about Teamwork.

You get three units and pick a general (Obviously you must pick Leonidas) andget in a game with (I think) 20 people (10 a team) and you coordinate to either wipe out the enemy army or get around them and capture their base.

You get to customize your units and as your general (Or should I say Leonidas) levels up, you can get new units with their own stats. Once your general (Leondias) is a high level, you can actually get the 300 Spartans and finally, be able to (sort of) recreate the last stand at Thermoplae (As stated before, you actually get a Thermoplae map).

Now there are problems.

4)  Not really that many generals to choose from (Obviously, even if theres a million generals, you must pick Leonidas), but seriously, give us more generals!

reviewText:
Total War: Arena is a simple game made in Total War’s battle system. Multiplayer only, right now, in the alpha phase.

Gameplay
Choose one type of unit. Choose one commander. You should do that. But if you choose   bad commander and you want to choose another, you need to do everything again.

“Where there is unity there is Victory”. Says it’s motto. In that game everytime you can win.
If you have many archers, you will fear of horses, but if you have many spearmen you will fear of archers. That’s the balance. You can win, everytime.

The team never be good. Matchmaking system make it impossible. Everywhere there are beginners and everywhere there are some professionals.

What’s are Tiers? Tiers show the unit’s level. Max tier is X (10). Your commander have tiers, too, not just the units. Your commander can level up by skills. If you have an amount of commander XP you can buy items for units or level up commander’s skills. If your commander get an amount of skills upgraded, he/she will get a bigger tier.

Everytime, in every battle you can bring only 3 units. (That means: 1 archers and 2 spearmen or 2 horses and 1 spearmen) Then you can go to a match.

And what’s the currency? There are gold and silver. Gold is what you can only buy by real money or by winning matches (Yes! You can get 100 gold/win). And you can get silver by playing matches.

Last words
Good to see another free2play RTS game.

Gameplay: 7/10 – Great Combat system, Great XP system, but it’s very slow.
Matchmaking: 6/10 – Very slow and just sometimes fast.
Design/Graphics: 7/10 – Very unoptimized, but nice.
Sound Design: 8/10 – Not bad, but can be better.
Free to Win: 8/10 – Free to win, but payers can progress faster

DO NOT FORGET: IT’S CLOSED ALPHA!


ALL: 72/100
Need a try.


Source: https://pcrage.wordpress.com/2015/05/16/total-war-arena/

reviewText: During wartime all now that it is not just your huge fancy army of mobs, nor is it an elite group of roman warriors, no, it's the united power of your forces and those of your allies that changes history. This F2P game uses the same ( or one alike ) battle engine as Rome 2. People familiar with Rome, will definitely be in their comfort zone. Though, there are some changes that clearly need some tweaking.
10v10 going head-to-head. 30 groups on both sides trying to fight head on or use stealth in unseen areas. Keep your eyes open, for an ambush is waiting!

Overall, the game is awesome. though some units need a bit rebalance. Artillery shoot like snipers, almost a 90% hit chance. archers are pretty strong and there doesn't seem to be any form of combat-lock. Escaping a lost fight can be really easy when you have the lighter ( read: faster ) troops.

pro's:
- love the upgrade features.
- A lot of usable troops with different abilities
- Pretty huge battle scale
- unit line of sight. makes the fight more intense and makes me very wary of unseen areas.

con's
- No combat lock, archers can easily escape an infantry charge and shoot em to bits and pieces
- Accuracy of catapults and scorpion like units.
- Just clicking Move" through an enemy unit does give you a damage penalty but you can move through the formation
date:
but sometimes the rear flank bonus ( moral shock ) makes that damage penalty pretty worth it. It should not be possible in my opinion.

TL;DR

ALPHA REVIEW GENTLEMEN, SO PLEASE PAY ATTENTION!

Unlike other Total War games, you can't simply charge right into the enemy line. You need to have a certain strategy every game. You need to work with your teammates to equally split your forces in such a way that so that you won't be flanked, but you would be able to flank the enemy.
Now comes the best part: you can only have 3 units of your choosing, but the number of players on each team is 10 so it would be better if you have a few mates to play with you and figure a way to work as a team. You have no chance of winning without teamwork, because every unit has its counter so DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT GO IN ALONE.
It has a troop progression system similar to that of World of Tanks, where you need to upgrade your current tier troops before getting new ones. Still, the tiers are still WIP so I can't really say anything else on this part of the game.
For an alpha version, it is quite stable, not even 1 game breaking bug or glitch found so far. If you enjoy the Total War series, be sure to try this one out, or if you want a way to relax just play a game on this, because even if you have a competitive nature you will not get upset or rage (most of the time at least).

reviewText:
Feels like World of Tanks, except with romans and greeks. Much more arcade-ish than a regular Total War game, but with a lot more options to customize and unlock new and better units. Really good for a Free to Play game, and there are no real pay-to-win factors in it either. Easy to learn, easy to play and extremely fun.


This game is not pay-to-win, more like pay-to-progress-faster. You can buy gold for real money, which can be used to do the following things:


-Buy more color packs which are used to customize the looks of your soldiers. Doesn't affect gameplay at all, other than your troops looking more customized.
-You can buy certain troops that can only be purchased with gold. My experience with them is that they look cool, but they are nothing special in their actual combat effectiveness.
-Convert your gold into commander exp (Free exp) or silver.


Silver is the only currency that is actually useful, and it is easily obtainable by playing the game. Factors like friendly fire and how much damage your units take decrease the amount of silver you earn from a battle, however even with those factors chiming in you will usually earn several thousand silver from every battle.

Overall a great arcade free to play game. It lacks the feeling of accomplishment that you will find in regular Total War games, however the game can not really be compared to any of the main Total War titles.
